ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin mētropolis, from Ancient Greek mētropolis (μητρόπολις, 'mother city, state'), from mḗtēr (μήτηρ, 'mother') + pólis (πόλις, 'city-state, city'). Originally referred to the mother city of a colony.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A very large and important city, often the capital or chief city of a country, state, or region.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 大都市；大都会；一个国家或地区的主要城市或经济、文化中心。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: New York City is a bustling metropolis that never sleeps.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 纽约市是一个永不眠的大都市。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Historical) The parent city or state of a colony; the original city from which a colony was founded.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （历史）宗主国；殖民地的母邦或发源城市。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Ancient Rome was the metropolis for many cities across its vast empire.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 古罗马是其庞大帝国中许多城市的宗主国。
